required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effects of a Tourniquet in Total Knee Arthroplasty.
clinical_study.official_title: The Effects of a Tourniquet on Implant Migration and Muscle Strength and Function in Patients Operated With Total Knee Arthroplasty

lead_sponsor.agency: Norwegian University of Science and Technology

collaborator.agency: St Olavs Hospital University Hospital in Trondheim

clinical_study.source: Norwegian University of Science and Technology

brief_summary.textblock: About 5000 total knee arthroplasties (TKA) are performed annually in Norway. Pain and reduced physical function is present in patients operated with TKA up to a year after surgery and about one of five patients are not satisfied with the outcome from TKA surgery. The use of tourniquet during surgery may also have impact on pain and physical function. Whether TKA surgery should be performed with or without the use of tourniquet, is a much-debated issue in orthopedic surgery today, and there is still no consensus in this field. This study will investigate early muscle strength and power recovery, neuromuscular recordings, neuronal changes and patient reported outcome measures after surgery with tourniquet versus not tourniquet.The findings in this study are expected to have implications for rehabilitation and the outcome of the TKA surgery.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from 1) preoperative (baseline) to day 2 postoperative, 2) change from preoperative to 8 weeks postoperative, 3) change from preoperative to 1 year postoperative
primary_outcome.description: EMG recordings are made using 10mm electrodes (Ag-AgCl) attached in a bipolar configuration over the vastus lateralis and rectus femoris

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from during surgery to 8 weeks postoperative
primary_outcome.description: Analysis from muscle biopsies harvested from the m. vastus lateralis

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from 1) preoperative (baseline) to 2) change from preoperative to 8 weeks postoperative, 3) change from preoperative to 1 year postoperative
primary_outcome.description: The stair climbing test measures the time (in seconds) to ascend, turn around and descend a regular stairway of 11 steps. The patients are asked to perform the test as quickly as possible.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from 1) preoperative (baseline) to day 2 postoperative, 2) change from preoperative to 8 weeks postoperative, 3) change from preoperative to 1 year postoperative
secondary_outcome.description: 1RM leg strength is measured using a leg press ergometer with the participant in a supine position (Steens Physical; Ring Mekanikk, Moelv, Norway)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from 1) preoperative (baseline) to day 2 postoperative, 2) change from preoperative to 8 weeks postoperative, 3) change from preoperative to 1 year postoperative
secondary_outcome.description: 1RM knee extension is measured using a knee extension equipment (Body-Solid, Forest Park, IL, USA) with the participant in a seated position.

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of force development, voluntary activation and muscle contractility
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from 1) preoperative (baseline) to day 2 postoperative, 2) change from preoperative to 8 weeks postoperative, 3) change from preoperative to 1 year postoperative
Cange from day 3 - 10 postoperative to 1 year postoperative (1 week measurement)
Preoperative, from day 1 postoperative to 4 weeks postoperative, 8 weeks and 1 years postoperative
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluating pain. The scale range from 0 (no pain) to 10 (worst pain imaginable) (7). The patients are asked to write down NRS values both at rest and during activity each day for the first 4 weeks postoperatively in a home log.
Total volume of bleeding during surgery and in the drain

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From day of surgery until 10 days postoperative

secondary_outcome.description: The circumference of the knee is measured 1 cm proximal to the patella base

secondary_outcome.measure: Gene expression analyses. RT-PCR for expression levels for VEGF, NGF, SP, CGRP, IL-6, IL-1, TNF-alpha, Bad, Bax, Bid, Bim, Fas, Fas-ligand, Bcl-2, Mcl, and FLIP. Results will be normalized to GAPDH expression levels.
secondary_outcome.description: Analysis from muscle biopsies harvested from the vastus lateralis (muscle)
Analysis from muscle biopsies harvested from the vastus lateralis (muscle)
Analysis from muscle biopsies harvested from the vastus lateralis (muscle)
Analysis from muscle biopsies harvested from the vastus lateralis (muscle)

arm_group.description: No use of tourniquet during surgery
Use of tourniquet during surgery. The cuff will be inflated to 300mmHg

intervention.description: In the patients randomized to the use of tourniquet, the tourniquet time starts before skin incision and terminates when the wound closure starts. The cuff pressure is set at 300mmHg.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Knee osteoarthrosis qualifying for total knee arthroplasty
Exclusion Criteria:
- Coagulation disease
- Rheumatoid arthritis
- Peripheral vascular disease
- Malign disease
- Pregnancy
- On-going infection
- Not able to understand written and oral information in Norwegian

overall_official.affiliation: Norwegian University of Science and Technology
